error.message: Call to deprecated method entityManager() of class Drupal. Deprecated in drupal:8.0.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use \Drupal::entityTypeManager() instead in most cases. If the needed method is not on \Drupal\Core\Entity\EntityTypeManagerInterface, see the deprecated \Drupal\Core\Entity\EntityManager to find the correct interface or service.

Call to deprecated method checkPlain() of class Drupal\Component\Utility\SafeMarkup: Will be removed before Drupal 9.0.0. Rely on Twig's auto-escaping feature, or use the @link theme_render #plain_text @endlink key when constructing a render array that contains plain text in order to use the renderer's auto-escaping feature. If neither of these are possible, \Drupal\Component\Utility\Html::escape() can be used in places where explicit escaping is needed.
Call to method checkPlain() of deprecated class Drupal\Component\Utility\SafeMarkup: Will be removed before Drupal 9.0.0. Use the appropriate
Call to deprecated function drush_log().
Call to deprecated function drush_delete_dir(): Use \Symfony\Component\Filesystem\Filesystem::remove.
Call to deprecated function drush_find_tmp(): Use $this->getConfig()->tmp() in a ConfigAware command.
Call to deprecated function drush_mkdir(): See \Symfony\Component\Filesystem\Filesystem::mkdir.
Call to deprecated function drush_delete_dir(): Use \Symfony\Component\Filesystem\Filesystem::remove.
Call to deprecated function drush_log().
Call to deprecated function drush_log().

Call to deprecated function drupal_get_profile(). Deprecated in drupal:8.3.0 and is removed from drupal:9.0.0. Use the install_profile container parameter or \Drupal::installProfile() instead. If you are accessing the value before it is written to configuration during the installer use the $install_state global. If you need to access the value before container is available you can use BootstrapConfigStorageFactory to load the value directly from configuration.

Add core_version_requirement: ^8 || ^9 to commonmark.info.yml to designate that the module is compatible with Drupal 9. See https://www.drupal.org/node/3070687.
